definition[0]: something you do in order to deceive someone
example[0]: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
example[1]: He didn’t really lose his wallet – that’s just a trick.
definition[1]: something you do to surprise someone and to make other people laugh
example[2]: I’m getting tired of your silly tricks.
example[3]: The girls were playing tricks on their teacher.
signpost[2]: something that makes things appear different
definition[2]: something that makes things appear to be different from the way they really are
example[4]: After walking for hours in the hot sun, his mind began playing tricks on him.
example[5]: At first he thought someone was coming towards him, but it was just a trick of the light.
definition[3]: a skilful set of actions that seem like magic, done to entertain people
example[6]: My uncle was always showing me card tricks when I was a kid.
definition[4]: a way of doing something that works very well but may not be easy to notice
example[8]: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
example[9]: a salesman who knew all the tricks of the trade  (=clever methods used in a particular job)
definition[5]: the cards played or won in one part of a game of cards
example[10]: He won the first three tricks easily.
definition[6]: someone who pays a prostitute to have sex
note[0]: turn a trick (=to have sex with someone for money)
definition[7]: to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
example[11]: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
example[12]: He claimed he was tricked into carrying drugs.
example[13]: The corporation was tricked out of $20 million.
example[14]: He tricked his way into her home by pretending to be a policeman.
note[3]: trick your way into/past/onto etc something
